item.title: Coding (basic)
item.description: On this page, you will find resources associated with each session in the basic-track coding workshop (zoom link, pw: sipps2021). A few days before each session, please check this page to make sure you’ve downloaded any necessary files in advance (if needed). After each session, the page will be updated with links to the corresponding zoom recording, as well as any additional materials/answer keys/etc. that were referenced during the workshop.

item.title: Professional Development / Journal Club
item.description: On this page, you will find resources associated with the Professional Development/Journal Club workshop series (zoom link, pw: sipps2021). Before each journal club session, check this page for details about which article that will be discussed. After each session in the series, the page will be updated with links to the corresponding zoom recording, as well as any additional materials that were referenced during the workshop. Week 1: What is a good research question?

Week 1: How to make the most of your summer experience (Dr. Valerie Purdie-Greenaway) View Recording Workshop materials: workshop slides

item.title: About the SIPPS Program
item.description: The SIPPS team comprises a group of graduate students, post-docs, undergraduates, and faculty advisors who are committed to diversity and inclusion, in its broadest sense. We are scientists whose day-to-day research seeks to understand how people think, behave, and relate to one other and how differences in our experiences, both positive and adverse, affect our brain, relationships, and behavior. Our work encompasses and embraces the ideas of diversity and support.

item.title: Diversity Statement
item.description: The SIPPS team comprises a group of graduate students, post-docs, undergraduates, and faculty advisors who are committed to diversity and inclusion, in its broadest sense. Our work encompasses and embraces the ideas of diversity and support.

item.title: Instructor Materials
item.description: Quick links for graduate students, postdocs, and staff in charge of putting on the SIPPS program. Feel free to disregard if you are a participant in this program. Please contact Manasi if you are unable to access any of the links below. instructor schedule SIPPS Drive folder guidelines for instructors guidelines for mentors mentor/mentee contract office hours zoom link (pw: sipps 2021) (for instructors/mentors) — held Thursdays 5-6pm EST office hours zoom link (pw: sipps 2021) (for near-peer mentors) — held Thursdays 5-6pm EST

item.title: Meet the SIPPS Team
item.description: SIPPS is a program developed & run primarily by graduate students, postdocs, and staff in Columbia’s Psychology Department. Program Directors Ana DiGiovanni is a PhD student in the Couples Lab. She studies social support processes and interpersonal emotion regulation strategies (i.e., co-rumination) that occur in close relationships (e.g., romantic relationships, friendships), especially during times of stress. email Anna Vannucci is a 2nd year PhD student working the DAN Lab.

item.title: Resources
item.description: On this page you will find an assortment of miscellaneous resources that you may find useful as a student interested in psychological research. Please note that all materials developed for specific workshop sessions will instead be found on the workshops page. Don’t hesitate to reach out to your mentor(s) and/or your instructors with specific questions about these resources. Programming Columbia Psychology Scientific Computing This website developed by graduate students in the psychology department contains a variety of introductory and advanced tutorials relevant for psychological data analysis using both R and python.

item.title: Schedule
item.description: SIPPS hosts three parallel workshop series running from the week of June 7 through the week of August 9, each with one session per week. See below for a detailed overview of all workshop topics and dates, and see the workshops page for materials and video recordings associated with each session. Also see the About page to view an introductory video and slide deck about the program. Coding Tuesdays, 4-5:30pm zoom: basic / adv

item.title: SIPPS 2020
item.description:
Check out the posters made by the participants of SIPPS 2020! Impact of Early Caregiving Adversity Timing on Later Life Anxiety Symptoms in Children Ariel Katz Mentor: Anna Vannucci
Social Support as a Moderator of the Effects of Loneliness on Emotional Eating in Parent-Adolescent Dyads (interactive poster link) Ayumi Tachida & Jamie Zhang Mentor: Ana DiGiovanni
The Effect of Instagram Usage on the Loss of Control of Eating: Anxiety and Emotional Reactivity as Moderators (interactive poster link) Barbara Djan
